preface.title: Notation Conventions
preface.para: In this manual code examples will be written in a monospaced font and all will have a title, like this:

To reference a certain class in the text we will mark the class like this: ClassName. The methods of a class are written like this ClassName::methodName (will be used for static members of the class) or this ClassName->methodName (for instance methods).
Parameters are denoted by a leading dollar sign ($, just as in PHP): $variable_name.
A typical function synopsis looks like this:
It displays one variant of the method call to the instance method Class->method and that it takes two parameters of parameterType, has one optional parameter and that it returns returnType.
